title: Man, 27, is hit and killed by driver seconds after pushing fiancée to safety
text:
A Texas man was hit and killed by a driver while riding his bicycle just seconds after pushing his fiancée to safety.

Devin Lee Custer, 27, and Stephanie Thompson were on their bikes Monday evening around 7pm when the accident occurred in Highlands.

According to a GoFundMe set up for Custer's family, 'Devin heroically saved his fiance's life by pushing her away from the vehicle, sacrificing his own life'.

Devin Lee Custer (left), 27, of Texas, was hit and killed by a driver while riding his bicycle just seconds after pushing his fiancée, Stephanie Thompson (right), to safety

Thompson said Custer heard a car approaching them and 'reached behind me and pushed me out of the way'. Thompson said: 'He loved with his whole heart. He showed it every single day. He was so selfless, and he always put me first'

Thompson told KTRK-TV that Custer heard a car approaching them and 'reached behind me and pushed me out of the way'.

'He loved with his whole heart. He showed it every single day. He was so selfless, and he always put me first,' she told the station.

Custer was pronounced dead at the scene.

According to the Harris County Sheriff's Office, he was not wearing a helmet at the scene.

'I just wish there was another way that he could have saved both of us and not just me,' Thompson told KTRK.

'I don't know how I can ever go on without him.'

Custer (pictured proposing to Thompson) was pronounced dead at the scene of the incident

Authorities said Custer and Thompson were riding their bikes (pictured) in the same direction as the vehicle before the crash

Investigators said Jason Stewart was driving the 2004 Cadillac Deville that struck Custer from behind. Stewart has not been charged, but police (at the scene) are investigating the incident

Authorities said Custer and Thompson were riding their bikes in the same direction as the vehicle before the crash.

Investigators told the Houston Chronicle that Jason Stewart was driving the 2004 Cadillac Deville that struck Custer from behind.

Custer did not have a rear red reflector nor did it have any other lighting device attached to it, according to the newspaper.

Custer was a 'much loved co-worker at MLN Company and he will be truly missed,' the GoFundMe page reads.

The page has raised more than $4,500 towards its $6,000 goal to help cover the cost of his funeral.

Stewart has not been charged, but police are investigating the incident.
description: Devin Lee Custer, 27, of Texas, was hit and killed by a driver while riding his bicycle just seconds after pushing his fiancée, Stephanie Thompson, to safety.
